raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago. A plain X-ray revealed advanced osteoarthritis (grade 4). Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and muscle relaxants were prescribed for approximately one month, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

json_data.current_medication: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and muscle relaxants
json_data.imaging_results: A plain X-ray revealed advanced osteoarthritis (grade 4)

reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain, a chief complaint that has been ongoing for five years and worsened two years ago. The ICD-10 code M17.0 is assigned for bilateral primary osteoarthritis based on the X-ray findings. The history of illness is detailed, showing a chronic condition. Current medication includes NSAIDs and muscle relaxants, which provided mild improvement. Imaging results from a plain X-ray confirm advanced osteoarthritis. The plan involves physiotherapy exercises, and the patient is scheduled for follow-up in two weeks to reassess the condition.
